html:
Nikos Koulis Releases New Wish Collection

In case you missed it, Nikos Koulis debuted a new high jewelry collection, titled “Wish,” at Paris Fashion Week. The collection was inspired by the Greek jeweler’s childhood memory of making wishes on dandelions, and took two whole years to finish. The pieces, many of which are one-of-a-kind and all of which are limited-edition, mimic the motion and delicacy of a dandelion with specially designed, invisible mechanisms turned into exquisite creations.

Louis Vuitton Adds to the Color Blossom Collection

Louis Vuitton’s iconic Color Blossom fine jewelry collection, which debuted 10 years ago, got an update this month with 27 new variations of the Monogram Flower. The exclusive color palette includes iridescent mother-of-pearl, green malachite, red cornelian, black onyx, and blue amazonite to create an assortment that can be layered together or worn solo for a pop of spring-ready color.

Trove Announces Beck as New Designer in Residence

Trove’s latest Designer in Residence will be none other than Beck, the jewelry brand founded by Rebecca Zeijdel-Paz. Known for her elegant, sculptural pieces, Zeijdel-Paz will present an exclusive collection for the residency, which will make for a perfect mix of Trove’s clean, colorful lines and her fluid, wearable art, at Trove’s store in New York City’s West Village.
